original: “Pubbeva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
analyzed: pubbā iva me bhikkhave sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: “Before my awakening — when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening — I thought:

original: ‘ko nu kho cakkhussa assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṁ nissaraṇaṁ?🔽Ko sotassa …pe…🔽ko ghānassa …🔽ko jivhāya …🔽ko kāyassa …
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho cakkhussa assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇa  kaḥ sotassa pe  kaḥ ghānassa  kaḥ jivhāya  kaḥ kāyassa
translated: ‘What’s the attraction of the eye, what’s the drawback, what’s the escape from it?

original: ko manassa assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṁ nissaraṇan’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ manassa assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇan ti
translated: What’s the attraction of the ear … nose … tongue … body … mind, what’s the drawback, what’s the escape from it?’

analyzed: tassa bhikkhave etat ahosi
translated: It occurred to me:

original: ‘yaṁ kho cakkhuṁ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ, ayaṁ cakkhussa assādo.
analyzed: yam kho cakkhum paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam cakkhussa assādaḥ
translated: ‘The pleasure & happiness that arise in dependence on the eye: That’s the attraction of the eye.

original: Yaṁ cakkhuṁ aniccaṁ dukkhaṁ vipariṇāmadhammaṁ, ayaṁ cakkhussa ādīnavo.
analyzed: yam cakkhum aniccam dukkham vipariṇāma dhamma ayam cakkhussa ādīnavaḥ
translated: That the eye is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: That’s the drawback.

original: Yo cakkhusmiṁ chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṁ, idaṁ cakkhussa nissaraṇaṁ.🔽Yaṁ sotaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhusmim chanda rāga vinayaḥ chanda rāga ppahāna idam cakkhussa nissaraṇa  yam sotam pe
translated: The removal & abandonment of desire & passion for the eye: That’s the escape from it.

original: yaṁ ghānaṁ …pe…🔽yaṁ jivhaṁ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ, ayaṁ jivhāya assādo.
analyzed: yam ghānam pe  yam jivham paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam jivhāya assādaḥ
translated: That the ear … nose … tongue … body … mind …🔽The pleasure & happiness that arise in dependence on the tongue: That’s the attraction of the tongue.

original: Yaṁ jivhā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṁ jivhāya ādīnavo.
analyzed: yam jivhā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāma dhammā ayam jivhāyaḥ ādīnavaḥ
translated: That the tongue is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: That’s the drawback.🔽The removal & abandonment of desire & passion for the tongue: That’s the escape from it.

original: Yo jivhāya chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṁ, idaṁ jivhāya nissaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ jivhāya chanda rāga vinayaḥ chanda rāga ppahānaḥ idam jivhāya nissaraṇa
translated: The removal and abandonment of desire-and-lust for the tongue is escape in the case of the tongue.

analyzed: yam kāyam pe
translated: The removal and abandonment of desire-and-lust for the body is escape in the case of the body.🔽The removal and abandonment of desire-and-lust for the mind is escape in the case of the mind.

original: yaṁ manaṁ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ, ayaṁ manassa assādo.
analyzed: yam manam paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam manassa assādaḥ
translated: “‘Whatever pleasure or joy arises in dependence on the mind: this is the gratification in the case of the mind.

original: Yaṁ mano anicco dukkho vipariṇāmadhammo, ayaṁ manassa ādīnavo.
analyzed: yam manaḥ aniccaḥ dukkhaḥ vipariṇāma dhammaḥ ayam manassa ādīnavaḥ
translated: That the mind is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change: this is the danger in the case of the mind.

original: Yo manasmiṁ chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṁ, idaṁ manassa nissaraṇan’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ manasmim chanda rāga vinayaḥ chanda rāga pahāne idam manassa nissaraṇa nti
translated: The removal and abandonment of desire-and-lust for the mind is escape in the case of the mind.’

original: Yāvakīvañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ ajjhattikānaṁ āyatanānaṁ evaṁ assādañca
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca āha bhikkhave imesam channam ajjhattikānam āyatanānam evam assādam ca
translated: “So long, bhikkhus, as I did not directly know as they really are the gratification in the case of these six internal sense bases,

original: assādato, ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ nābbhaññāsiṁ,🔽neva tāvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya
analyzed: assādataḥ ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam  na iva tau āha bhikkhave sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya
translated: the danger in the case of these six external sense bases, and the escape in the case of these six external sense bases,🔽I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Mara, and Brahma, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.

analyzed: sa deva manussāya anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ ti paccaññāsi
translated: But when I directly knew all this as it really is, then I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with … its devas and humans.

original: Yato ca khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ ajjhattikānaṁ āyatanānaṁ evaṁ assādañca🔽assādato, ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,🔽athāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya
analyzed: yatas ca khvā āha bhikkhave imesam channam ajjhattikānam āyatanānam evam assādam ca  assādataḥ ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam  atha āha bhikkhave sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya
translated: But when I knew the gratification, the danger, and the escape in regard to these six internal sense spheres,

analyzed: sa deva manussāya anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ ti paccaññāsi
translated: then I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

analyzed: ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: And knowledge and vision arose in me:

original: ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.
analyzed: akuppā me vimutti ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavoti
translated: ‘My deliverance is unshakable; this is my last birth; now there is no renewal of being. ’”

analyzed: pubbā iva me bhikkhave sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: “Bhikkhus, before my awakening, while I was still a bodhisatta, not yet fully awakened, it occurred to me:

analyzed: kaḥ phoṭṭhabbānam
translated: What is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of odours? …🔽What is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of tastes? …🔽What is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of tactile objects? …

analyzed: kaḥ dhammānam assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇan ti
translated: What is the gratification in them, what is the danger, and what is the escape?

analyzed: tassa bhikkhave etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to me:

original: ‘yaṁ kho rūpe paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ, ayaṁ rūpānaṁ assādo.
analyzed: yam kho rūpe paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam rūpānam assādaḥ

original: Yaṁ rūpā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṁ rūpānaṁ ādīnavo.
analyzed: yam rūpā aniccāḥ dukkhāḥ vipariṇāma dhammāḥ ayam rūpānaṃ ādīnavaḥ
translated: The fact that form is inconstant, stressful, subject to change: this is the danger in form.

original: Yo rūpesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṁ, idaṁ rūpānaṁ nissaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ rūpesu chanda rāga vinayaḥ chanda rāga pahānaḥ idam nissaraṇa
translated: The subduing of desire-passion for form, the abandoning of desire-passion for form: this is the escape from form.

analyzed: yam sadde  gandhe  rase
translated: The pleasure and joy that arise in dependence on sound…🔽in dependence on aroma…🔽in dependence on flavor…

analyzed: phoṭṭhabbe

original: yaṁ dhamme paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ, ayaṁ dhammānaṁ assādo.
analyzed: yam dhamme paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam dhammānam assādaḥ
translated: in dependence on idea…

original: Yaṁ dhammā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṁ dhammānaṁ ādīnavo.
analyzed: yam dhammāḥ aniccāḥ dukkhāḥ vipariṇāma dhammāḥ ayam dhammānam ādīnavaḥ
translated: The fact that ideas are inconstant, stressful, subject to change: this is the danger in ideas.

original: Yo dhammesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṁ, idaṁ dhammānaṁ nissaraṇan’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ dhammesu chanda rāga vinayaḥ chanda rāga ppahāne idam dhammānam nissaraṇa ti
translated: The subduing of desire-passion for ideas, the abandoning of desire-passion for ideas: this is the escape from ideas.’

original: Yāvakīvañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ bāhirānaṁ āyatanānaṁ evaṁ assādañca assādato,
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca āha bhikkhave imesam channam bāhirānam āyatanānam evam assādam ca assādato
translated: “And so, monks, for as long as I did not fully know these six internal sense-media in terms of gratification and danger, and escape from them, I did not claim to have awakened to the right self-awakening concerning this world with its devas, Māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people, and to have realized the right self-awakening.🔽But when I did fully know these six internal sense-media in terms of gratification and danger, and escape from them, then I claimed to have awakened to the right self-awakening concerning this world with its devas, Māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people, and to have realized the right self-awakening.

original: ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ nābbhaññāsiṁ, neva tāvāhaṁ,🔽bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya
analyzed: ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam na abbhaññāsi na iva tau āha  bhikkhave sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya
translated: I did not understand as it really is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of sensual pleasures.🔽As long as I did not know as it really is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of sensual pleasures,🔽I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

original: ‘anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti paccaññāsiṁ.🔽Yato ca khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ bāhirānaṁ āyatanānaṁ evaṁ assādañca assādato,🔽ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, athāhaṁ,🔽bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya
analyzed: anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ iti paccaññā asi  yatas ca khvā āha bhikkhave imesam channam bāhirānam āyatanānam evam assādam ca assādato  ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam atha āha  bhikkhave sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya
translated: I did not fully understand the drawbacks of drawbacks, the escape from escape, and so I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Māra, and Brahmā, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.

analyzed: anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ iti paccaññā asi
translated: But when I fully understood the drawbacks of drawbacks, the escape from escape, and so I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Māra, and Brahmā, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.

analyzed: ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: And knowledge and vision arose in me:

original: ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.
analyzed: akuppā me vimutti ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavoti
translated: ‘Unprovoked is my liberation of mind. This is my last birth. Now there is no continuation of existence.’”

analyzed: dutiya
translated: The second.

analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The Connected Discourses with Yamaka,

analyzed: yamaka vagga

analyzed: paṭhama assāda pariyesana sutta
translated: The first search for gratification🔽“Bhikkhus, I have sought gratification in the eye,

original: “Cakkhussāhaṁ, bhikkhave, assādapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo cakkhussa assādo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhussa aha bhikkhave assāda pariyesanam acari  yaḥ cakkhussa assādaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: and I reached as far as the gratification in the eye extended.

original: Yāvatā cakkhussa assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Cakkhussāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ādīnavapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo cakkhussa ādīnavo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā cakkhussa assādo paññāya me so su diṭṭho  cakkhussa aha bhikkhave ādīnava pariyesanam acari  yaḥ cakkhussa ādīnavaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: With the wisdom that ‘The gratification in the eye has been fully understood’ I have abandoned the underlying tendency to lust.🔽I have sought danger in the eye,🔽and I reached as far as the danger in the eye extended.🔽With the wisdom that ‘The danger in the eye has been fully understood’ I have abandoned the underlying tendency to lust.

original: Yāvatā cakkhussa ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Cakkhussāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nissaraṇapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yaṁ cakkhussa nissaraṇaṁ tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā cakkhussa ādīnavaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  cakkhussa aha bhikkhave nissaraṇa pariyesanam acari  yam cakkhussa nissaraṇam tat ajjhagama
translated: I have sought the escape from the eye,🔽and I reached as far as the escape from the eye extended.

original: Yāvatā cakkhussa nissaraṇaṁ, paññāya me taṁ sudiṭṭhaṁ.🔽Sotassāhaṁ, bhikkhave …
analyzed: yāvatā cakkhussa nissaraṇa paññāya me tam su diṭṭha  sotassa āha bhikkhave
translated: With the wisdom that ‘The escape from the eye has been fully understood’ I have abandoned the underlying tendency to lust.🔽I have sought gratification in the ear…

original: ghānassāhaṁ, bhikkhave …🔽jivhāyāhaṁ bhikkhave, assādapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo jivhāya assādo tadajjhagamaṁ.🔽Yāvatā jivhāya assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
analyzed: ghānassa āha bhikkhave  jivhāya aham bhikkhave assāda pariyesanam acari  yaḥ jivhāya tat ajjhagama  yāvatā jivhāya assādo paññāya me so su diṭṭho
translated: I have sought gratification in the nose…🔽I have sought gratification in the tongue,🔽and I reached as far as the gratification in the tongue extended.

analyzed: jivhāya āha bhikkhave ādīnava pariyesanam acari
translated: With the wisdom that ‘The gratification in the tongue has been fully understood’ I have abandoned the underlying tendency to lust.🔽I have sought danger in the tongue,🔽and I reached as far as the danger in the tongue extended.

analyzed: yaḥ ādīnavaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: I discovered the drawbacks in the tongue.

original: Yāvatā jivhāya ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Jivhāyāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nissaraṇapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā jivhāya ādīnavaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  jivhāya āha bhikkhave nissaraṇa pariyesanam acari
translated: As far as there are drawbacks in the tongue, I’ve seen them with wisdom.

original: Yaṁ jivhāya nissaraṇaṁ tadajjhagamaṁ.🔽Yāvatā jivhāya nissaraṇaṁ, paññāya me taṁ sudiṭṭhaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yam jivhāya nissaraṇam tat ajjhagama  yāvatā jivhāya nissaraṇa paññāya me tam su diṭṭham pe
translated: I’ve searched for the escape from the tongue.🔽I’ve discovered the escape from the tongue.

analyzed: manassā aha bhikkhave assāda pariyesanam acari
translated: As far as there is an escape from the tongue, I’ve seen it with wisdom.

analyzed: yaḥ manassa assādaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: I’ve searched for the gratification in the mind.🔽I’ve discovered the gratification in the mind.

original: Yāvatā manassa assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Manassāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ādīnavapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo manassa ādīnavo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā manassa assādaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  manassā aha bhikkhave ādīnava pariyesanam acari  yaḥ manassaḥ ādīnavaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: As far as there is gratification in the mind, I’ve seen it with wisdom.🔽I’ve searched for the drawbacks in the mind.🔽I’ve discovered the drawbacks in the mind.

original: Yāvatā manassa ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Manassāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nissaraṇapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā manassa ādīnavaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  manassā aha bhikkhave nissaraṇa pariyesanam acari
translated: As far as there are drawbacks in the mind, I’ve seen them with wisdom.

analyzed: yam manassa nissaraṇam tat ajjhagama
translated: I’ve searched for the escape from the mind.🔽I’ve discovered the escape from the mind.

original: Yāvatā manassa nissaraṇaṁ, paññāya me taṁ sudiṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā manassa nissaraṇa paññāya me tam su diṭṭha
translated: As far as there is an escape from the mind, I’ve seen it with wisdom.

original: Yāvakīvañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ ajjhattikānaṁ āyatanānaṁ assādañca assādato, ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ nābbhaññāsiṁ …pe…
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca āha bhikkhave imesam channam ajjhattikānam āyatanānam assādam ca assādataḥ ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam na abbhaññāsim pe
translated: “Bhikkhus, as long as I did not directly know as they really are the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of these six internal bases, I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Mara, and Brahma, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.

analyzed: paccaññā asi
translated: But when I directly knew all this as it really is, then I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with … its devas and humans.

analyzed: ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: And, bhikkhus, knowledge and vision arose in me:

original: ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 35.16
analyzed: akuppā me vimutti ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavoti  tatiya  sayutta nikāya
translated: ‘Unshakable is my liberation of mind; this is my last birth; now there is no renewal of being.’”🔽The third section on the six bases is finished.

analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Connected Discourses with Yamaka

analyzed: dutiya assāda pariyesana sutta
translated: The Search for Gratification, Second Version

original: “Rūpānāhaṁ, bhikkhave, assādapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo rūpānaṁ assādo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: rūpāna aha bhikkhave assāda pariyesanam acari  yaḥ rūpānam tat ajjhagama
translated: “Bhikkhus, I have given up searching for gratification in forms,🔽and I have discovered the gratification in forms that is to be discovered.

original: Yāvatā rūpānaṁ assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Rūpānāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ādīnavapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo rūpānaṁ ādīnavo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā rūpānam assādaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  rūpāna aha bhikkhave ādīnava pariyesanam acari  yaḥ ādīnavaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: I have discovered the gratification in forms as far as gratification is to be discovered in forms.🔽I have given up searching for danger in forms,🔽and I have discovered the danger in forms that is to be discovered.

original: Yāvatā rūpānaṁ ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
analyzed: yāvatā rūpānaṃ ādīnavaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho
translated: I have discovered the danger in forms as far as danger is to be discovered in forms.

analyzed: rūpāna aha bhikkhave nissaraṇa pariyesanam acari
translated: I have given up searching for an escape from forms,

analyzed: yam nissaraṇam tat ajjhagama
translated: and I have discovered the escape from forms that is to be discovered.

original: Yāvatā rūpānaṁ nissaraṇaṁ, paññāya me taṁ sudiṭṭhaṁ.🔽Saddānāhaṁ, bhikkhave …
analyzed: yāvatā rūpānam nissaraṇa paññāya me tam su diṭṭha  saddāni āha bhikkhave
translated: I have seen with wisdom what is the escape from form.🔽“Bhikkhus, I have investigated happiness as to whether it is agreeable or disagreeable, and I have seen with wisdom what is the danger in happiness.🔽I have investigated sound …🔽I have investigated odour …🔽I have investigated taste …

analyzed: gandhān āha bhikkhave  rasān āha bhikkhave
translated: I have investigated tactile objects …🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are agreeable or disagreeable, and I have seen with wisdom what is the danger in mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to their gratification, and I have seen with wisdom what is the gratification in mental phenomena.

analyzed: phoṭṭhabbān āha bhikkhave
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to their danger, and I have seen with wisdom what is the danger in mental phenomena.

analyzed: dhammāna aha bhikkhave assāda pariyesanam acari
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to their escape, and I have seen with wisdom what is the escape from mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are the self or different from the self, and I have seen with wisdom what is the self and what is different from the self.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are permanent or impermanent, and I have seen with wisdom what is the impermanence of mental phenomena.

analyzed: yaḥ dhammānam assādaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are pleasant or painful, and I have seen with wisdom what is the pain in mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are self or not self, and I have seen with wisdom what is not self.

original: Yāvatā dhammānaṁ assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Dhammānāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ādīnavapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yo dhammānaṁ ādīnavo tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā dhammānam assādaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  dhammāna aha bhikkhave ādīnava pariyesanam acari  yaḥ dhammānam ādīnavaḥ tat ajjhagama
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are pure or impure, and I have seen with wisdom what is the impurity of mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are to be developed or not to be developed, and I have seen with wisdom what is the development of mental phenomena.

original: Yāvatā dhammānaṁ ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.🔽Dhammānāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nissaraṇapariyesanaṁ acariṁ.🔽Yaṁ dhammānaṁ nissaraṇaṁ tadajjhagamaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā dhammānam ādīnavaḥ paññāya me so su diṭṭho  dhammāna aha bhikkhave nissaraṇa pariyesanam acari  yam dhammānam nissaraṇam tat ajjhagama
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are to be comprehended or not to be comprehended, and I have seen with wisdom what is the comprehension of mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are to be abandoned or not to be abandoned, and I have seen with wisdom what is the abandoning of mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are to be directly known or not to be directly known, and I have seen with wisdom what is the direct knowledge of mental phenomena.

original: Yāvatā dhammānaṁ nissaraṇaṁ, paññāya me taṁ sudiṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā dhammānam nissaraṇa paññāya me tam su diṭṭha
translated: I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are to be realized or not to be realized, and I have seen with wisdom what is the realization of mental phenomena.🔽I have investigated mental phenomena as to whether they are

original: Yāvakīvañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ channaṁ bāhirānaṁ āyatanānaṁ assādañca assādato, ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ nābbhaññāsiṁ …pe… paccaññāsiṁ.🔽Ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṁ udapādi:
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca āha bhikkhave imesam channam bāhirānam āyatanānam assādam ca assādataḥ ādīnavam ca ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇam ca nissaraṇataḥ yathābhūtam na abbhaññāsim pe paccaññāsi  ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: “Bhikkhus, as long as I did not directly know as they really are the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of these six external bases, I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Mara, and Brahma, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.🔽But when I directly knew all this as it really is, then I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with … its devas and humans.

original: ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: akuppā me vimutti ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavoti  catuttha
translated: And, bhikkhus, through revulsion towards the six external bases, through their fading away and cessation, I attained revulsion, their fading away and cessation, and through revulsion towards the six external bases, through their fading away and cessation, I attained nibbana.”🔽Thus spoke the Blessed One.

analyzed: sayutta nikāya  yamaka vagga
translated: The Book of the Fives

analyzed: paṭhama nocea ssāda sutta
translated: The First on Gratification, etc.

original: “No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, cakkhussa assādo abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā cakkhusmiṁ sārajjeyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave cakkhussa assādaḥ abhavissa na idam sattā cakkhusmiṃ sārajjeyyu
translated: “Bhikkhus, if there were no gratification in the eye, beings would not become enamored of it;

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi cakkhussa assādo tasmā sattā cakkhusmiṁ sārajjanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi cakkhussa assādo tasmā sattā cakkhusmiṃ sārajjanti
translated: but because there is gratification in the eye, beings become enamored of it.

analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave cakkhussa ādīnavaḥ abhavissa na idam sattā cakkhusmiṃ nibbindeyyu

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi cakkhussa ādīnavo tasmā sattā cakkhusmiṁ nibbindanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi cakkhussa ādīnavaḥ tasmā sattā cakkhusmiṃ nibbindanti
translated: but because there is danger in the eye, beings experience revulsion towards it.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, cakkhussa nissaraṇaṁ abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā cakkhusmā nissareyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave cakkhussa nissaraṇam abhavissa na idam sattā cakkhusmā nissareyyu
translated: If there were no escape from the eye, beings would not escape from suffering.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi cakkhussa nissaraṇaṁ tasmā sattā cakkhusmā nissaranti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi cakkhussa nissaraṇam tasmā sattā cakkhusmā nissaranti
translated: But because there is an escape from the eye, beings escape from suffering.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, sotassa assādo abhavissa …
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave sotassa assādaḥ abhavissa
translated: “If there were no gratification in the ear …

original: no cedaṁ, bhikkhave, ghānassa assādo abhavissa …
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave ghānassa assādaḥ abhavissa
translated: If there were no gratification in the nose …

original: no cedaṁ, bhikkhave, jivhāya assādo abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā jivhāya sārajjeyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave jivhāya assādaḥ abhavissa na idam sattāḥ jivhāya sārajjeyyu
translated: If there were no gratification in the tongue, beings would not be infatuated with the tongue.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi jivhāya assādo, tasmā sattā jivhāya sārajjanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi jivhāya assādo tasmā sattā jivhāya sārajjanti
translated: But because there is gratification in the tongue, beings are infatuated with the tongue.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, jivhāya ādīnavo abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā jivhāya nibbindeyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave jivhāya ādīnavaḥ abhavissa na idam sattāḥ jivhāya nibbindeyyu
translated: If there were no danger in the tongue, beings would not grow disenchanted with the tongue.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi jivhāya ādīnavo, tasmā sattā jivhāya nibbindanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi jivhāya ādīnavaḥ tasmā sattāḥ jivhāya nibbindanti
translated: But because there is danger in the tongue, beings grow disenchanted with the tongue.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, jivhāya nissaraṇaṁ abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā jivhāya nissareyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave jivhāya nissaraṇam abhavissa na idam sattāḥ jivhāya nissareyyu
translated: If there were no escape from the tongue, beings would not escape from suffering.🔽But because there is an escape from the tongue, beings escape from suffering.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi jivhāya nissaraṇaṁ, tasmā sattā jivhāya nissaranti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi jivhāya nissaraṇa tasmā sattāḥ jivhāya nissaranti
translated: But because there is an escape from the tongue, beings escape from the tongue.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, kāyassa assādo abhavissa …
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave kāyassa assādaḥ abhavissa
translated: If there were no gratification in the body …

original: no cedaṁ, bhikkhave, manassa assādo abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā manasmiṁ sārajjeyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave manassa assādaḥ abhavissa na idam sattāḥ manasmin sārajjeyyu
translated: If there were no gratification in the mind, beings would not be attracted to the mind.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi manassa assādo, tasmā sattā manasmiṁ sārajjanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi manassa assādo tasmā sattāḥ manasmim sārajjanti
translated: But because there is gratification in the mind, beings are attracted to the mind.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, manassa ādīnavo abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā manasmiṁ nibbindeyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave manassa ādīnavaḥ abhavissa na idam sattāḥ manasmim nibbindeyyu
translated: If there were no danger in the mind, beings would not become disenchanted with the mind.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi manassa ādīnavo, tasmā sattā manasmiṁ nibbindanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi manassa ādīnavaḥ tasmā sattāḥ manasmiṃ nibbindanti
translated: But because there is danger in the mind, beings become disenchanted with the mind.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, manassa nissaraṇaṁ abhavissa, nayidaṁ sattā manasmā nissareyyuṁ.
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave manassa nissaraṇam abhavissa na idam sattāḥ manasmā nissareyyu
translated: If there were no escape from the mind, beings would not escape from the mind.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi manassa nissaraṇaṁ, tasmā sattā manasmā nissaranti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave atthi manassa nissaraṇa tasmā sattāḥ manasmā nissaranti
translated: But because there is an escape from the mind, beings escape from the mind.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, sattā imesaṁ channaṁ ajjhattikānaṁ āyatanānaṁ assādañca assādato,🔽ādīnavañca ādīnavato, nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṁ nābbhaññaṁsu, neva tāva,

analyzed: yat ca bhikkhave cakkhu ye ca rūpāḥ yat ca cakkhu viññāṇa ye ca cakkhu viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ pe yā ca jivhā ye ca rasāḥ yañca jivhā viññāṇa ye ca jivhā viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā
translated: the ear, sounds, ear-consciousness, and things cognizable with ear-consciousness;🔽the nose, smells, nose-consciousness, and things cognizable with nose-consciousness;🔽the tongue, tastes, tongue-consciousness, and things cognizable with tongue-consciousness;

original: yo ca kāyo, ye ca phoṭṭhabbā, yañca kāyaviññāṇaṁ, ye ca kāyaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā;
analyzed: yaḥ ca kāyaḥ ye ca phoṭṭhabbāḥ yat ca kāya viññāṇa ye ca kāya viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: the body, tactile objects, body-consciousness, and things cognizable with body-consciousness;

original: yo ca mano, ye ca dhammā, yañca manoviññāṇaṁ, ye ca manoviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā—🔽idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, sabbaṁ anabhijānaṁ aparijānaṁ avirājayaṁ appajahaṁ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: yaḥ ca manaḥ ye ca dhammāḥ yat ca manaḥ viññāṇa ye ca manaḥ viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ  idam kho bhikkhave sabbam an abhijānam a parijānam a virājayam a pajaham abhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: the mind, mental phenomena, mind-consciousness, and things cognizable with mind-consciousness.🔽This is the all without fully knowing and fully seeing which … there is no disenchantment and dispassion, and no knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Sabbaṁ, bhikkhave, abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave abhijānam parijānam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “Bhikkhus, when all is fully known and fully seen by the Tathagata, there is disenchantment and dispassion, and there is knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Kiñca, bhikkhave, sabbaṁ abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāya?
analyzed: kiñca bhikkhave sabbam abhijānam parijānam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: And what is the all that, by fully understanding and completely breaking through, one is capable of destroying suffering?🔽The eye, forms, eye-consciousness, and things cognizable with eye-consciousness;

original: Yañca, bhikkhave, cakkhu, ye ca rūpā, yañca cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, ye ca cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā …pe…
analyzed: yat ca bhikkhave cakkhu ye ca rūpāḥ yat ca cakkhu viññāṇa ye ca cakkhu viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ pe
translated: the ear, sounds, ear-consciousness, and things cognizable with ear-consciousness;🔽the nose, smells, nose-consciousness, and things cognizable with nose-consciousness;

original: yā ca jivhā, ye ca rasā, yañca jivhāviññāṇaṁ, ye ca jivhāviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā;
analyzed: yā ca jivhā ye ca rasāḥ yañca jivhā viññāṇa ye ca jivhā viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā
translated: the tongue, tastes, tongue-consciousness, and things cognizable with tongue-consciousness;

original: yo ca kāyo, ye ca phoṭṭhabbā, yañca kāyaviññāṇaṁ, ye ca kāyaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā;
analyzed: yaḥ ca kāyaḥ ye ca phoṭṭhabbāḥ yat ca kāya viññāṇa ye ca kāya viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: the body, tactile objects, body-consciousness, and things cognizable with body-consciousness;

original: yo ca mano, ye ca dhammā, yañca manoviññāṇaṁ, ye ca manoviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā—
analyzed: yaḥ ca manaḥ ye ca dhammāḥ yat ca manaḥ viññāṇa ye ca manaḥ viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: the mind, mental phenomena, mind-consciousness, and things cognizable with mind-consciousness.

original: idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, sabbaṁ abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
analyzed: idam kho bhikkhave sabbam abhijānam parijānam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: By fully understanding and completely breaking through this all, one is capable of destroying suffering.”

analyzed: ādittasutta
translated: The Burning

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā gayāyaṁ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṁ bhikkhusahassena.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā gayāyam viharati gayāsīse saddhim bhikkhu sahassena
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling at Gayā at Gayā Head together with a thousand monks.

analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: sabba bhikkhave āditta
translated: “Monks, everything is burning.

analyzed: kiñca bhikkhave sabbam
translated: And what is the everything that is burning?

original: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, ādittaṁ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ ādittaṁ, cakkhusamphasso🔽āditto. Yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā
analyzed: cakkhu bhikkhave āditta rūpā ādittā cakkhu viññāṇam āditta cakkhu samphassaḥ  ādittaḥ yat pi idam cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā
translated: The eye is burning. Forms are burning. Eye-consciousness is burning. Eye-contact is burning.

analyzed: adukkham asukham vā
translated: And whatever there is that is felt as pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant that arises with eye-contact as condition is also burning.

analyzed: kena āditta
translated: And with what is it burning?

original: ‘Rāgagginā, dosagginā, mohagginā ādittaṁ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan’ti vadāmi …pe…

translated: I say it is burning with the fire of passion, the fire of aversion, the fire of delusion; it is burning with birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair.

original: jivhā ādittā, rasā ādittā, jivhāviññāṇaṁ ādittaṁ, jivhāsamphasso āditto. Yampidaṁ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi ādittaṁ.

translated: The ear is burning. Sounds are burning. Ear-consciousness is burning. Ear-contact is burning. And whatever there is that is felt as pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant that arises with ear-contact as condition is also burning.

analyzed: kena āditta
translated: And with what is it burning?

original: ‘Rāgagginā, dosagginā, mohagginā ādittaṁ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan’ti vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: rāga agginā dosa agginā moha agginā āditta jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi āditta nti vadāmi pe
translated: ‘It is burning with the fire of lust, the fire of hatred, and the fire of delusion. It is burning with birth, aging, and death, with sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair, I say.

original: mano āditto, dhammā ādittā, manoviññāṇaṁ ādittaṁ, manosamphasso āditto. Yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi ādittaṁ.
analyzed: manaḥ ādittaḥ dhammāḥ ādittāḥ manaḥ viññāṇam āditta manaḥ samphassaḥ ādittaḥ yam pidam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi āditta
translated: The mind is burning, thoughts are burning, mind-consciousness is burning, mind-contact is burning, and whatever feeling arises dependent on mind-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, that too is burning.

analyzed: kena āditta
translated: With what is it burning?

original: ‘Rāgagginā, dosagginā, mohagginā ādittaṁ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan’ti vadāmi.🔽Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati,
analyzed: rāga agginā dosa agginā moha agginā āditta jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi āditta nti vadāmi  evam passa bhikkhave sutavā ariya sāvako cakkhusmim pi nibbindati rūpesu pi nibbindati
translated: ‘It is burning with the fire of lust, the fire of hatred, and the fire of delusion. It is burning with birth, aging, and death, with sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair, I say.

original: cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati, yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇe api nibbindati cakkhu samphasse api nibbindati yam pidam cakkhu samphassa paccayā
translated: “Seeing thus, bhikkhus, the instructed noble disciple experiences revulsion towards the eye, towards forms, towards eyeconsciousness, towards eye-contact, towards whatever feeling arises dependent on eye-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.🔽“Experiencing revulsion, he becomes dispassionate.🔽Through dispassion his mind is ,

original: uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe…
analyzed: uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tasmim pi nibbindati pe
translated: pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises, he becomes dispassionate towards it, …

original: yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.
analyzed: yam pi idam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tasmim pi nibbindati

analyzed: jivhā addha bhūtā rasāḥ addha bhūtā jivhā viññāṇam addha bhūta jivhā samphassaḥ addha bhūtaḥ  yat pi idam jivhā samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukha

translated: I say that it is overwhelmed by birth, aging, and death; by sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair; I say that it is overwhelmed by suffering.🔽“Seeing thus, bhikkhus, the instructed noble disciple experiences revulsion towards the eye, towards forms, towards eyeconsciousness, towards eye-contact, and towards whatever feeling arises with eye-contact as condition—whether pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

original: yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.

He understands: ‘Destroyed is birth, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming back to any state of being.’“🔽The seventh section on the one who has seven years of life remaining is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Māluṅkyaputta are finished.

analyzed: samugghāta sāruppa sutta
translated: The Way to Uplift the Mind

analyzed: sabba maññita samugghāta sāruppam vaḥ bhikkhave paṭipadam desessāmi
translated: “I will teach you the way to uplift the mind.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmīti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

original: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppā paṭipadā?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṁ na maññati, cakkhusmiṁ na maññati, cakkhuto na maññati, cakkhuṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: katamā ca sā bhikkhave sabba maññita samugghāta sāruppā paṭipadā  idha bhikkhave bhikkhu cakkhum na maññati cakkhusmin na maññati cakkhutas na maññati cakkhum mā iti na maññati
translated: “And what is the way to uplift the mind?

original: Rūpe na maññati, rūpesu na maññati, rūpato na maññati, rūpā meti na maññati.
analyzed: rūpe na maññati rūpesu na maññati rūpataḥ na maññati rūpā mā iti na maññati
translated: It’s when a monk doesn’t identify with the eye, doesn’t identify with eye-consciousness, doesn’t identify with eye-contact, and doesn’t identify anything as ‘my eye-contact’ or ‘my consciousness due to eye-contact’ or ‘my feeling that’s caused by mind-contact’.

original: Cakkhuviññāṇaṁ na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇasmiṁ na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇato na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ meti na maññati.🔽Cakkhusamphassaṁ na maññati, cakkhusamphassasmiṁ na maññati, cakkhusamphassato na maññati, cakkhusamphasso meti na maññati.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam na maññati cakkhu viññāṇasmin na maññati cakkhu viññāṇataḥ na maññati cakkhu viññāṇam mā iti na maññati  cakkhu samphassam na maññati cakkhu samphassasmin na maññati cakkhu samphassataḥ na maññati cakkhu samphassaḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive eye-consciousness, he does not conceive in eye-consciousness, he does not conceive from eye-consciousness, he does not conceive ‘eye-consciousness is mine.’🔽He does not conceive eye-contact, he does not conceive in eye-contact, he does not conceive from eye-contact, he does not conceive ‘eye-contact is mine.’

original: Yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati …pe…
analyzed: yam pi idam cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati pe
translated: He does not conceive the feeling that arises because of eye-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, he does not conceive in that feeling, he does not conceive from that feeling, he does not conceive ‘that feeling is mine.’ …

original: jivhaṁ na maññati, jivhāya na maññati, jivhāto na maññati, jivhā meti na maññati.
analyzed: jivham na maññati jivhāya na maññati jivhātaḥ na maññati jivhā mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the tongue, he does not conceive in the tongue, he does not conceive from the tongue, he does not conceive ‘the tongue is mine.’

original: Rase na maññati, rasesu na maññati, rasato na maññati, rasā meti na maññati.
analyzed: rase na maññati rasesu na maññati rasataḥ na maññati rasāḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive tastes, he does not conceive in tastes, he does not conceive from tastes, he does not conceive ‘tastes are mine.’

original: Jivhāviññāṇaṁ na maññati, jivhāviññāṇasmiṁ na maññati, jivhāviññāṇato na maññati, jivhāviññāṇaṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: jivhā viññāṇam na maññati jivhā viññāṇasmin na maññati jivhā viññāṇataḥ na maññati jivhā viññāṇam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive tongue-consciousness, he does not conceive in tongue-consciousness, he does not conceive from tongue-consciousness, he does not conceive ‘tongue-consciousness is mine.’

original: Jivhāsamphassaṁ na maññati, jivhāsamphassasmiṁ na maññati, jivhāsamphassato na maññati, jivhāsamphasso meti na maññati.
analyzed: jivhā samphassam na maññati jivhā samphassasmin na maññati jivhā samphassataḥ na maññati jivhā samphassaḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the tongue, does not conceive in the tongue, does not conceive from the tongue, does not conceive ‘the tongue is mine.’

original: Yampidaṁ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati …pe…
analyzed: yam pi idam jivhā samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati pe
translated: He does not conceive the pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that arises conditioned by tongue-contact; he does not conceive in it, does not conceive from it, does not conceive ‘that is mine.’ …

original: manaṁ na maññati, manasmiṁ na maññati, manato na maññati, mano meti na maññati.
analyzed: manam na maññati manasmin na maññati manataḥ na maññati manaḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the mind, does not conceive in the mind, does not conceive from the mind, does not conceive ‘the mind is mine.’

original: Dhamme na maññati, dhammesu na maññati, dhammato na maññati, dhammā meti na maññati.🔽Manoviññāṇaṁ na maññati, manoviññāṇasmiṁ na maññati, manoviññāṇato na maññati, manoviññāṇaṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: dhamme na maññati dhammesu na maññati dhammataḥ na maññati dhammāḥ mā iti na maññati  manaḥ viññāṇam na maññati manaḥ viññāṇasmin na maññati manaḥ viññāṇataḥ na maññati manaḥ viññāṇam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive mental phenomena, does not conceive in mental phenomena, does not conceive from mental phenomena, does not conceive ‘mental phenomena are mine.’🔽He does not conceive mind-consciousness, does not conceive in mind-consciousness, does not conceive from mind-consciousness, does not conceive ‘mind-consciousness is mine.’

original: Manosamphassaṁ na maññati, manosamphassasmiṁ na maññati, manosamphassato na maññati, manosamphasso meti na maññati.
analyzed: manaḥ samphassam na maññati manaḥ samphassasmin na maññati manaḥ samphassataḥ na maññati manaḥ samphassaḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive mind-contact, does not conceive in mind-contact, does not conceive from mind-contact, does not conceive ‘mind-contact is mine.’

original: Yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: yam pi idam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the feeling that arises with mind-contact as ‘I am’ or ‘I am this’ or ‘I am otherwise’ or ‘I am possessed of mind-contact’ or ‘Mind-contact is mine.’

original: Sabbaṁ na maññati, sabbasmiṁ na maññati, sabbato na maññati, sabbaṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: sabbam na maññati sabbasmin na maññati sabbatas na maññati sabbam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive of it as ‘mine,’ ‘not mine,’ ‘I,’ ‘I am,’ or ‘I am otherwise.’

original: So evaṁ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
analyzed: saḥ evam a maññamānaḥ na ca kiñci loke upādiyati
translated: Not conceiving anything in this way, he does not cling to anything in the world.🔽Not clinging, he is not agitated.

original: Anupādiyaṁ na paritassati. Aparitassaṁ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati.
analyzed: anupādiyam na paritassati a paritassam paccattaññā iva parinibbāyati
translated: Not being agitated, he personally attains nibbāna.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He discerns that ‘Birth is ended, the holy life fulfilled, the task done. There is nothing further for this world.’”

original: Ayaṁ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppā paṭipadā”ti.🔽Aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho sā bhikkhave sabba maññita samugghāta sāruppā paṭipadā ati  aṭṭhama
translated: This is the way directed to the abandoning of all conceivings.”🔽The eighth section on the way directed to the abandoning of all conceivings is finished.

analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The Connected Discourses with the Sakyans,

analyzed: sabba vagga
translated: The Chapter on All,

analyzed: paṭhama samugghāta sappāya sutta  sabba maññita samugghāta sappāyam vaḥ bhikkhave paṭipadam desessāmi
translated: The Way to Abandonment, First🔽“Bhikkhus, I will teach you the way to abandon all conceivings.

analyzed: tam suṇātha
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā?
analyzed: katamā ca sā bhikkhave sabba maññita samugghāta sappāyā paṭipadā
translated: And what is the way that leads to the abandoning of all conceivings?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṁ na maññati, cakkhusmiṁ na maññati, cakkhuto na maññati, cakkhuṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu cakkhum na maññati cakkhusmin na maññati cakkhutas na maññati cakkhum mā iti na maññati
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu does not conceive the eye, does not conceive in the eye, does not conceive from the eye, does not conceive ‘the eye is mine.’

original: Rūpe na maññati …pe…🔽cakkhuviññāṇaṁ na maññati, cakkhusamphassaṁ na maññati, yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā
analyzed: rūpe na maññati pe  cakkhu viññāṇam na maññati cakkhu samphassam na maññati yam pidam cakkhu samphassa paccayā
translated: He does not conceive forms …

original: uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi
analyzed: uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi
translated: He does not conceive eye-consciousness … He does not conceive eye-contact … He does not conceive as pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant that feeling which arises with eye-contact as condition.

original: na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati.🔽Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṁ maññati, yato maññati, yaṁ meti maññati, tato taṁ hoti aññathā.
analyzed: na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati  yat hi bhikkhave maññati yasmin maññati yatas maññati yam mā iti maññati tatas tam hoti aññathā
translated: He does not conceive that feeling, does not conceive in the feeling, does not conceive from the feeling, does not conceive ‘the feeling is mine.’🔽For what a person conceives, holds to, and considers as ‘mine,’ that becomes otherwise,

original: Aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandati …pe…🔽jivhaṁ na maññati, jivhāya na maññati, jivhāto na maññati, jivhā meti na maññati.
analyzed: aññathābhāvī bhava sattaḥ lokaḥ bhavam eva abhinandati pe  jivham na maññati jivhāya na maññati jivhātaḥ na maññati jivhā mā iti na maññati
translated: and when it becomes otherwise, he laments, is dejected, and bewails, weeps beating his breast and becomes distraught.🔽He does not conceive the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body …

analyzed: rase na maññati pe
translated: He does not conceive mind …

original: jivhāviññāṇaṁ na maññati, jivhāsamphassaṁ na maññati.
analyzed: jivhā viññāṇam na maññati jivhā samphassam na maññati
translated: He does not conceive consciousness at the tongue, nor does he conceive in consciousness at the tongue, nor does he conceive from consciousness at the tongue, nor does he conceive ‘consciousness at the tongue is mine.’

original: Yampidaṁ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: yam pi idam jivhā samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that arises conditioned by tongue-contact. He does not conceive it, does not conceive in it, does not conceive from it, does not conceive ‘that is mine.’

original: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṁ maññati, yato maññati, yaṁ meti maññati, tato taṁ hoti aññathā.
analyzed: yat hi bhikkhave maññati yasmin maññati yatas maññati yam mā iti maññati tatas tam hoti aññathā
translated: “Bhikkhus, whatever one conceives, whatever one conceives in, whatever one conceives from, whatever one conceives ‘is mine,’ changes in the end.

analyzed: aññathābhāvī bhava sattaḥ lokaḥ bhavam eva abhinandati pe
translated: The worldling delights in becoming, delights in mere becoming, rejoices in mere becoming.

original: manaṁ na maññati, manasmiṁ na maññati, manato na maññati, mano meti na maññati.
analyzed: manam na maññati manasmin na maññati manataḥ na maññati manaḥ mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the mind, nor does he conceive in the mind, nor does he conceive from the mind, nor does he conceive ‘the mind is mine.’

original: Dhamme na maññati …pe…🔽manoviññāṇaṁ na maññati, manosamphassaṁ na maññati.
analyzed: dhamme na maññati pe  manaḥ viññāṇam na maññati manaḥ samphassam na maññati
translated: He does not conceive mental phenomena …🔽He does not conceive consciousness at the mind, nor does he conceive in consciousness at the mind, nor does he conceive from consciousness at the mind, nor does he conceive ‘consciousness at the mind is mine.’

original: Yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: yam pi idam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi na maññati tasmim pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati
translated: He does not conceive the pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that arises conditioned by mind-contact. He does not conceive it, does not conceive in it, does not conceive from it, does not conceive ‘that is mine.’

original: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṁ maññati, yato maññati, yaṁ meti maññati, tato taṁ hoti aññathā.
analyzed: yat hi bhikkhave maññati yasmin maññati yatas maññati yam mā iti maññati tatas tam hoti aññathā
translated: Whatever one conceives, whatever one conceives in, whatever one conceives from, whatever one conceives as ‘mine’—that turns out to be otherwise.

analyzed: aññathābhāvī bhava sattaḥ lokaḥ bhavam eva abhinandati
translated: The worldling, who is subject to change, delights in becoming.

original: Yāvatā, bhikkhave, khandhadhātuāyatanaṁ tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṁ meti na maññati.
analyzed: yāvatā bhikkhave khandha dhātu āyatanam tam pi na maññati tasmin pi na maññati tatas api na maññati tam mā iti na maññati
translated: As far as there are the aggregates, the elements, and the sense bases, one does not conceive of them, does not conceive in them, does not conceive from them, does not conceive ‘they are mine.’

original: So evaṁ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
analyzed: saḥ evam a maññamānaḥ na ca kiñci loke upādiyati
translated: Not conceiving thus, one does not grasp at anything in the world.

original: Anupādiyaṁ na paritassati. Aparitassaṁ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati.
analyzed: anupādiyam na paritassati a paritassam paccattaññā iva parinibbāyati
translated: Not grasping, one is not agitated. Not being agitated, one personally attains nibbāna.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: One understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’🔽This is the way to the complete destruction of all conceivings.”

original: Ayaṁ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā”ti.🔽Navamaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho sā bhikkhave sabba maññita samugghāta sappāyā paṭipadā ati  navama
translated: The ninth section on the way leading to the cessation of conceit is finished.

analyzed: sayutta nikāya  sabba vagga
translated: The Connected Discourses with Devadatta, the first, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Devadatta, the second, is finished.

analyzed: dutiya samugghāta sappāya sutta  sabba maññita samugghāta sappāyam vaḥ bhikkhave paṭipadam desessāmi

original: “Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.🔽Yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe…

translated: “When he sees this, a learned noble disciple grows weary of the eye, grows weary of forms, grows weary of eye-consciousness, grows weary of eye-contact.🔽He grows weary of whatever feeling arises with eye-contact as condition — whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

original: jivhāyapi nibbindati, rasesupi …pe… yampidaṁ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe….

translated: He grows weary of the ear …

original: Manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati.
analyzed: manasmim pi nibbindati dhammesu pi nibbindati manaḥ viññāṇe pi nibbindati manaḥ samphasse pi nibbindati
translated: He grows weary of the mind, grows weary of mental phenomena, grows weary of mind-consciousness, grows weary of mind-contact.

analyzed: manasmim pi nibbindati dhammesu pi nibbindati manaḥ viññāṇe pi nibbindati manaḥ samphasse pi nibbindati
translated: He becomes dispassionate towards the mind, dispassionate towards thoughts, dispassionate towards mind-consciousness, dispassionate towards mind-contact.🔽And whatever feeling arises in dependence on mind-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, he becomes dispassionate towards that too.🔽Being dispassionate, he detaches his mind from it. When the mind is detached, it is released. When it is released, it is settled. When it is settled, it is tranquil. Translation: Manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati.

original: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

translated: Then a certain monk went to the Blessed One, and after paying homage to him, he sat down at one side and said to him: 🔽“When, venerable sir, does ignorance end and knowledge arise?”

original: “kathaṁ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṁ passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjatī”ti?🔽“Cakkhuṁ kho, bhikkhu, aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.

translated: Experiencing revulsion, he becomes dispassionate.🔽Through dispassion his mind is ,🔽he becomes dispassionate. Through dispassion his mind is liberated. When it is liberated there comes the knowledge: ‘It’s liberated.’

analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati

original: Nandisaṁyojanasaṁyutto kho, migajāla, bhikkhu sadutiyavihārīti vuccati.

original: Evaṁvihārī ca, migajāla, bhikkhu kiñcāpi araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni;

analyzed: atha kho sa dutiya vihārī iti vuccati

analyzed: tam kim sa hetu

analyzed: taṇhā hissa dutiyā sā assa appahīnā

analyzed: tasmā sa dutiyavihārī iti vuccati
translated: That is why he is said to abide with a companion.

original: Santi ca kho, migajāla, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.

original: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.🔽Tassa taṁ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nandī nirujjhati.🔽Nandiyā asati sārāgo na hoti;

analyzed: sārāge asati sayogaḥ na
translated: When there is no craving, there is no clinging.🔽A bhikkhu who is detached from the fetter of delight is said to abide alone.

analyzed: nandi sayojana visa yuttaḥ kho migajāla bhikkhu eka vihārī iti vuccati pe

original: santi ca kho, migajāla, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.🔽Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: santi ca kho migajāla manaḥ viññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  tat ce bhikkhu na abhinandati na abhivadati na ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati

analyzed: sārāge asati sayogaḥ na

original: Nandisaṁyojanavippayutto kho, migajāla, bhikkhu ekavihārīti vuccati.
analyzed: nandi sayojana vippayuttaḥ kho migajāla bhikkhu eka vihārī iti vuccati

analyzed: nandi nirodhā dukkha nirodho migajālā ati vadāmi iti
translated: With the cessation of delight, what do you think, Migajāla, would sorrow cease?”🔽“Then, Migajāla, it is in such a way that I declare the cessation of this whole mass of suffering.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā migajālo bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.🔽Atha kho āyasmā migajālo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharato nacirasseva—yassatthāya🔽kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā migajālaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi  atha kho āyasmā migajālaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharataḥ  kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: Then, having delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words, the venerable Migajāla rose from his seat, paid homage to the Blessed One, circumambulated him, keeping him to his right, and departed.

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: Then, dwelling alone, withdrawn, diligent, ardent, and resolute, the venerable Migajāla, by realising for himself with direct knowledge, here and now entered upon and abided in that supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: He directly experienced the reward of freedom.

original: Aññataro ca panāyasmā migajālo arahataṁ ahosīti.
analyzed: aññataro ca pana ayasmai migajālaḥ arahatam ahosi iti
translated: And Venerable Migajāla became another one of the perfected ones.

translated: The second section is finished.

translated: Saṃyutta Nikāya 54.18

The First Questions of Samiddhi and Māra

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: One time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi yena bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: atha kho yena bhagavān
translated: Then Venerable Samiddhi went to the Buddha …

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him,

analyzed: māraḥ māraḥ ti bhante vuccati
translated: “‘Māra, Māra,’ it’s said.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, māro vā assa mārapaññatti vā”ti?🔽“Yattha kho, samiddhi, atthi cakkhu, atthi rūpā, atthi cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, atthi cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante māraḥ vā assa māra paññatti vā ati  yattha kho samiddhi atthi cakkhu atthi rūpā atthi cakkhu viññāṇa atthi cakkhu viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: In what way is one Māra or a representative of Māra?”🔽“Samiddhi, there is an eye, there are sights, there is eye consciousness, there are things known by eye consciousness. There is Māra or a representative of Māra right there.

original: Atthi sotaṁ, atthi saddā, atthi sotaviññāṇaṁ, atthi sotaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: atthi sota atthi saddāḥ atthi sota viññāṇa atthi sota viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is an ear, there are sounds, there is ear consciousness, there are things known by ear consciousness. There is Māra or a representative of Māra right there.🔽There is a nose, there are smells, there is nose consciousness, there are things known by nose consciousness. There is Māra or a representative of Māra right there.

original: Atthi ghānaṁ, atthi gandhā, atthi ghānaviññāṇaṁ, atthi ghānaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: atthi ghāna atthi gandhāḥ atthi ghāna viññāṇa atthi ghāna viññātabbā dhammā atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is the nose, there are scents, there is nose-consciousness, there are things to be experienced by nose-consciousness. There is Māra or one who is of Māra’s people.

original: Atthi jivhā, atthi rasā, atthi jivhāviññāṇaṁ, atthi jivhāviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: atthi jivhā atthi rasāḥ atthi jivhā viññāṇa atthi jivhā viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is the tongue, there are tastes, there is tongue-consciousness, there are things to be experienced by tongue-consciousness. There is Māra or one who is of Māra’s people.

original: Atthi kāyo, atthi phoṭṭhabbā, atthi kāyaviññāṇaṁ, atthi kāyaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: atthi kāyaḥ atthi phoṭṭhabbāḥ atthi kāya viññāṇa atthi kāya viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is the body, there are tangibles, there is body-consciousness, there are things to be experienced by body-consciousness. There is Māra or one who is of Māra’s people.

original: Atthi mano, atthi dhammā, atthi manoviññāṇaṁ, atthi manoviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: atthi manaḥ atthi dhammāḥ atthi manaḥ viññāṇa atthi manaḥ viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā atthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is the mind, there are thoughts, there is mind-consciousness, there are things to be experienced by mind-consciousness. There is Māra or one who is of Māra’s people.

original: Yattha ca kho, samiddhi, natthi cakkhu, natthi rūpā, natthi cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, natthi cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, natthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.🔽Natthi sotaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yattha ca kho samiddhi natthi cakkhu natthi rūpā natthi cakkhu viññāṇa natthi cakkhu viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā natthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā  natthi sotam pe
translated: But where there is no eye, no forms, no eye-consciousness, no things to be experienced by eye-consciousness, there is no Māra or one who is of Māra’s people.🔽Where there is no ear …

analyzed: natthi ghānam pe
translated: Where there is no nose …

original: natthi jivhā, natthi rasā, natthi jivhāviññāṇaṁ, natthi jivhāviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, natthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
analyzed: natthi jivhā natthi rasāḥ natthi jivhā viññāṇa natthi jivhā viññāṇa viññātabbā dhammā natthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā
translated: There is no tongue, no tastes, no tongue consciousness, no things to be known by tongue consciousness, and there is no Māra or anyone who makes Māra happen there.

analyzed: natthi kāyaḥ pe
translated: There is no body …

original: Natthi mano, natthi dhammā, natthi manoviññāṇaṁ, natthi manoviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, natthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā”ti.
analyzed: natthi manaḥ natthi dhammā natthi manaḥ viññāṇa natthi manaḥ viññāṇa viññātabbāḥ dhammāḥ natthi tattha māraḥ vā māra paññatti vā ati
translated: There is no mind, no thoughts, no mind consciousness, no things to be known by mind consciousness, and there is no Māra or anyone who makes Māra happen there.”

analyzed: aham jivhāti vā mama jivhāti vā pe
translated: or I am the tongue, or the tongue is mine,

original: ahaṁ manoti vā mama manoti vā’.
analyzed: aham manoti vā mama manoti vā
translated: or I am the mind, or the mind is mine.’

original: Tassa mayhañca kho, āvuso sāriputta, kiṁ kāyassa vā aññathattaṁ bhavissati, indriyānaṁ vā vipariṇāmo”ti.
analyzed: tassa mayham ca kho āvuso sāriputta kim kāyassa vā aññathattam bhavissati indriyānam vā vipariṇāmaḥ ti
translated: So what change could there be in my body or my faculties?”

original: Tathā hi panāyasmato upasenassa dīgharattaṁ ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānānusayo susamūhato.

original: ahaṁ jivhāti vā mama jivhāti vā …pe…

translated: ‘I am the mind’ or ‘The mind is mine.’“

analyzed: miga jāla vagga

analyzed: upavāṇa sandiṭṭhika sutta
translated: The Discussion with Upavāna about What Can Be Seen for Oneself

original: Atha kho āyasmā upavāṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe…
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai upavāṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami pe
translated: Then the Venerable Upavāṇa went to the Buddha …

original: ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai upavāṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

analyzed: sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammo sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammo ti bhante vuccati
translated: “Venerable sir, it is said, ‘The Dhamma can be seen for oneself, can be realized for oneself, can be seen directly by the wise.’

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti, akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammaḥ hoti akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: In what way, venerable sir, is the Dhamma seen for oneself, realized for oneself, a method that is directly visible, immediate, inviting one to come and see, applicable, to be personally experienced by the wise?”

original: “Idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā rūpappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.
analyzed: idha pana upavāṇa bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā rūpa ppaṭisavedī ca hoti rūpa rāga ppaṭisavedī ca
translated: “Upavāṇa, when a bhikkhu sees a form with the eye, he is experience and he is also experience of lust for form.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam rūpesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam rūpesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti
translated: He knows that he has lust for forms in dependence on the six internal sense spheres.

original: Yaṁ taṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā rūpappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.
analyzed: yam te upavāṇa bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā rūpa ppaṭisavedī ca hoti rūpa rāga ppaṭisavedī ca
translated: “When a bhikkhu sees a form with the eye, he is one who feels and one who is lustful.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam rūpesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam rūpesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti
translated: He knows that he has lust for forms in dependence on the six internal sense spheres.

original: Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi …pe….
analyzed: evam pi kho upavāṇa sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammaḥ hoti akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi pe
translated: This is how, Upavana, there is a way to understand the Dhamma by oneself…

original: Puna caparaṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti rasarāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.

translated: “Again, Upavana, when a bhikkhu tastes a taste with the tongue, he is one who feels and one who is lustful.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ rasesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ rasesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam rasesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam rasesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti
translated: He knows that he has lust for tastes in dependence on the six internal sense spheres.

original: Yaṁ taṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti rasarāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.

translated: When a bhikkhu tastes a taste with the tongue, he is one who feels and one who is lustful.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ rasesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ rasesu rāgo’ti pajānāti. Evampi
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam rasesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam rasesu rāgaḥ ti pajānāti evam pi
translated: He knows that he has lust for tastes in himself.

original: kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi …pe….
analyzed: kho upavāṇa sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammaḥ hoti akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi pe
translated: In this way, Upavāna, the Dhamma is visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward-leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves. …

original: Puna caparaṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṁ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammarāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.

translated: Again, Upavāna, a bhikkhu, having known with the mind a mind object, is one who feels it and one who feels lust for it.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ dhammesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam dhammesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam dhammesu rāgaḥ ti pajānāti
translated: He knows that he has lust for mind objects in himself.

original: Yaṁ taṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṁ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammarāgappaṭisaṁvedī ca.
analyzed: yam te upavāṇa bhikkhu manasā dhammam viññāya dhamma ppaṭisavedī ca hoti dhamma rāga ppaṭisavedī ca
translated: In this way, Upavāna, a bhikkhu, having known with the mind a mind object, is one who feels it and one who feels lust for it.

original: Santañca ajjhattaṁ dhammesu rāgaṁ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: santam ca ajjhattam dhammesu rāgam atthi me ajjhattam dhammesu rāgaḥ ti pajānāti
translated: He knows that he has lust for mind objects in himself.

original: Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti …pe… paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi …pe….
analyzed: evam pi kho upavāṇa sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammaḥ hoti pe paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi pe
translated: In this way, Upavāna, the Dhamma is visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward-leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves. …

original: Idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā rūpappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti, no ca rūparāgappaṭisaṁvedī.

translated: “There is the case where a monk, on seeing a form via the eye, is one who feels the form, but is not one who feels lust for the form.🔽And he does not discern that there is lust within.

original: Asantañca ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgaṁ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.🔽Yaṁ taṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā rūpappaṭisaṁvedīhi kho hoti, no ca rūparāgappaṭisaṁvedī.
analyzed: asantam ca ajjhattam rūpesu rāgam na atthi me ajjhattam rūpesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti  yam te upavāṇa bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā rūpa ppaṭisavedīhi kho hoti no ca rūpa rāga ppaṭisavedī
translated: ‘There is no lust within me’—

original: Asantañca ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgaṁ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: asantam ca ajjhattam rūpesu rāgam na atthi me ajjhattam rūpesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti

analyzed: evam pi kho upavāṇa sandiṭṭhikaḥ dhammaḥ hoti akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi pe
translated: This is how there is a Dhamma seen right within oneself that is unproclaimed, of which the world is unaware, and which leads the one who practices it to a special knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

original: Puna caparaṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṁvedīhi kho hoti,🔽no ca rasarāgappaṭisaṁvedī. Asantañca ajjhattaṁ rasesu rāgaṁ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ
analyzed: puna caparaḥ upavāṇa bhikkhu jivhāya rasam sāyitvā rasa paṭisavedīhi kho hoti  no ca rasa rāga paṭisavedī asantam ca ajjhattam rasesu rāgam natthi me ajjhatta
translated: “And further, on tasting a taste via the tongue, he is one who feels the taste, but is not one who feels lust for the taste.🔽And he does not discern that there is lust within.🔽‘There is no lust within me’—

analyzed: rasesu rāgaḥ iti pajānāti
translated: he discerns this and is not agitated.

original: Puna caparaṁ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṁ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṁvedīhi kho hoti, no ca dhammarāgappaṭisaṁvedī.

translated: When he has known with wisdom that ‘On seeing a form, a bhikkhu feels neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, he knows ‘I feel neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.’🔽When he has known with wisdom that ‘On hearing a sound…On smelling an odour…On tasting a flavour…On touching a tangible…🔽On cognizing a mind-object, a bhikkhu feels pleasure, he knows ‘I feel pleasure.’🔽When he has known with wisdom that ‘On cognizing a mind-object, a bhikkhu feels displeasure, he knows ‘I feel displeasure.’
