original: Imasmiñca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṁ bhaññamāne āyasmato rāhulassa anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimucci.

analyzed: ime vuccanti bhikkhave sayojaniyāḥ dhammāḥ

translated: Vesālī

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: One time the Blessed One was staying at Vesālī in the Great Wood in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Atha kho uggo gahapati vesāliko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho uggo gahapati vesāliko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu uggaḥ gahapatiḥ vesālikaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu uggaḥ gahapatiḥ vesālikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the Vesālī householder Ugga went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, sat to one side. As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,🔽“Lord, I have heard that it is said, ‘The world is the world.’

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme no parinibbāyanti
translated: “What is the cause, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in the plane of misery, in a bad destination, in the lower world, in hell?

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: And what is the cause, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world?”

original: “Santi kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā
translated: “Householder, there are forms cognizable by the eye that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, tantalizing.

original: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṁ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati tassa tam abhinandataḥ abhivadataḥ ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti tad upādāna
translated: If a bhikkhu delights in them, welcomes them, and remains holding to them, his consciousness becomes dependent on them and clings to them.

analyzed: sa aupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu no parinibbāyati pe
translated: A bhikkhu who is dependent and clinging does not attain Nibbana.

analyzed: santi kho gahapati jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ pe
translated: There are sounds cognizable by the ear…

original: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati manaḥ viññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā
translated: There are thoughts cognizable by the mind that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, tantalizing.

original: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṁ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati tassa tam abhinandataḥ abhivadataḥ ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti tad upādāna
translated: If a monk delights in and welcomes that perception and remains holding to it, then consciousness connected with that delight in and welcoming of perception and having that as its source remains fixed.

original: Saupādāno, gahapati, bhikkhu no parinibbāyati.🔽Ayaṁ kho, gahapati, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti.
analyzed: sa aupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu no parinibbāyati  ayam kho gahapati hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme no parinibbāyanti
translated: A monk who has clinging does not attain nibbāna.🔽This is the reason, this is the cause why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Santi ca kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.
analyzed: santi ca kho gahapati cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā
translated: There are, householder, forms cognizable by the eye…

original: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṁ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti, na tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu na abhinandati na abhivadati na ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati tassa tam an abhinandataḥ an abhivadataḥ an ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ na tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti na tad upādāna
translated: If a monk does not delight in and welcome that perception and does not remain holding to it, then consciousness not connected with that delight in and welcoming of perception and not having that as its source remains fixed.

analyzed: anupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu parinibbāyati pe
translated: A monk who has no clinging attains nibbāna.

analyzed: santi kho gahapati jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ pe
translated: There are, householder, sounds cognizable by the ear…🔽There are, householder, odours cognizable by the nose…

original: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.🔽Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṁ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato. Na tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti, na tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati manaḥ viññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  tat ce bhikkhu na abhinandati na abhivadati na ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati tassa tam an abhinandataḥ an abhivadataḥ an ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ na tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti na tad upādāna
translated: There are mind-objects cognizable by the mind that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, tantalizing.

analyzed: anupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu parinibbāyati
translated: If a bhikkhu does not delight in them, welcome them, and hold on to them, then delight, welcome, and clinging cease in him. With the cessation of delight, welcome, and clinging, grasping ceases. With the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases. With the cessation of becoming, birth ceases. With the cessation of birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair cease. Such is the cessation of this whole mass of suffering.

original: Ayaṁ kho, gahapati, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho gahapati hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: This, householders, is the reason, this is the cause why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.”

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā piṇḍolabhāradvājo kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.🔽Atha kho rājā udeno yenāyasmā piṇḍolabhāradvājo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā piṇḍolabhāradvājena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā piṇḍolabhāradvājaḥ kosambiyam viharati ghosita ārāme  atha khalu rājā udenaḥ yena āyasmā piṇḍola bhāradvājaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā piṇḍola bhāradvājena saddhim sammodi
translated: One time the venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja was staying at Kosambī in the Ghosita Park.🔽Then King Udena went to the venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja and exchanged greetings with him.🔽When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja:

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho rājā udeno āyasmantaṁ piṇḍolabhāradvājaṁ etadavoca:

translated: “Master Bhāradvāja, there are these four castes: the nobles, the brahmins, the merchants, and the workers.

analyzed: yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā a nikīḍitāvinaḥ kāmesu yāvajīvam
translated: that these young monks, who are so young and youthful, with black hair, endowed with the blessing of youth, in the first stage of life, and who have not dallied with sensual pleasures,

analyzed: parisuddham brahmacariyam caranti addhānam ca āpādenti iti
translated: live the complete and pure holy life all their lives, and make an end of suffering?”

original: “Vuttaṁ kho etaṁ, mahārāja, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena:
analyzed: vuttam kho eta mahā rāja tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena
translated: “Great king, this has been said by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened:

original: ‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, mātumattīsu mātucittaṁ upaṭṭhapetha, bhaginimattīsu bhaginicittaṁ upaṭṭhapetha, dhītumattīsu dhītucittaṁ upaṭṭhapethā’ti.🔽Ayaṁ kho, mahārāja, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā bhadrena
analyzed: tumhe bhikkhave mātu mattīsu mātu cittam upaṭṭhapetha bhagini mattīsu bhagini cittam upaṭṭhapetha dhītu mattīsu dhītu cittam upaṭṭhapetha ati  ayam kho mahā rāja hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesāḥ bhadrena
translated: ‘Come, monks, in regard to those who are like a mother, arouse a mother-like mind; in regard to those who are like a sister, arouse a sister-like mind; in regard to those who are like a daughter, arouse a daughter-like mind.’

original: yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ
analyzed: yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā a nikīḍitāvinaḥ kāmesu yāvajīvam

analyzed: parisuddham brahmacariyam caranti addhānam ca āpādenti iti
translated: live the complete and pure holy life all their lives, and make an end of suffering.”

analyzed: lolam kho bho bhāradvāja citta
translated: “The mind is fickle, sir.

original: Appekadā mātumattīsupi lobhadhammā uppajjanti, bhaginimattīsupi lobhadhammā uppajjanti, dhītumattīsupi lobhadhammā uppajjanti.
analyzed: appekadā mātumattīsu pi lobha dhammāḥ uppajjanti bhaginimattīsu pi lobha dhammāḥ uppajjanti dhītumattīsu pi lobha dhammāḥ uppajjanti
translated: Sometimes lustful thoughts arise even about one’s mother, sister, or daughter.

original: Atthi nu kho, bho bhāradvāja, añño ca hetu, añño ca paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā …pe… addhānañca āpādentī”ti?
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho bhāradvāja añño ca hetu añño ca paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā pe addhānañca āpādenti iti
translated: But is there another reason why these young monks, who are so well-proportioned, with so much to look forward to in life, shave off their hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth into homelessness?”

original: “Vuttaṁ kho etaṁ, mahārāja, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena:
analyzed: vuttam kho eta mahā rāja tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena

original: ‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, imameva kāyaṁ uddhaṁ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṁ pūraṁ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhatha—🔽atthi imasmiṁ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṁsaṁ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṁ vakkaṁ
analyzed: tumhe bhikkhave imam eva kāyam uddham pāda talāḥ adhas kesamatthakāḥ taca pariyantam pūram nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhatha  atthi imasmin kāye kesāḥ lomā nakhāḥ dantāḥ tacaḥ masam nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjam vakka
translated: ‘Monks, you should contemplate this very body, from the soles of the feet on the bottom to the tips of the hairs on the top, and from the skin on the outside to the nails on the hands and feet, as full of many kinds of impurities:🔽In this body there are head hairs, body hairs, nails, teeth, skin,🔽flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney,🔽heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, feces, bile,

original: hadayaṁ yakanaṁ kilomakaṁ pihakaṁ papphāsaṁ antaṁ antaguṇaṁ udariyaṁ karīsaṁ pittaṁ
analyzed: hadayam yakanam kilomakam pihakam papphāsam antam antaguṇam udariyam karīsam pitta
translated: phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovic fluid, urine.

original: semhaṁ pubbo lohitaṁ sedo medo assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttan’ti.
analyzed: semham pubbaḥ lohitam sedaḥ medaḥ assu vasā kheḷaḥ siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttanti
translated: Phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, spittle, snot, oil of the joints, urine.”

original: Ayampi kho, mahārāja, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā …pe… addhānañca āpādentī”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho mahā rāja hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā pe addhānam ca āpādenti iti
translated: “This is the reason, great king, this is the cause why these young bhikkhus, fresh and new novices, with little hair and beard, who eat in other people’s homes and are given almsfood, robes, bedding, and medicine,

original: “Ye te, bho bhāradvāja, bhikkhū bhāvitakāyā bhāvitasīlā bhāvitacittā bhāvitapaññā, tesaṁ taṁ sukaraṁ hoti.
analyzed: ye te bho bhāradvāja bhikkhū bhāvita kāyāḥ bhāvita sīlāḥ bhāvita cittāḥ bhāvita paññā tesam tam sukaram hoti
translated: “Those bhikkhus, Master Bharadvaja, who are developed in body, developed in virtue, developed in mind, and developed in wisdom, for them that is easy.

original: Ye ca kho te, bho bhāradvāja, bhikkhū abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā, tesaṁ taṁ dukkaraṁ hoti.
analyzed: ye ca kho te bho bhāradvāja bhikkhū abhāvita kāyāḥ abhāvita sīlāḥ abhāvita cittāḥ abhāvita paññā tesam tat dukkaram hoti
translated: But those bhikkhus who are undeveloped in body, undeveloped in virtue, undeveloped in mind, and undeveloped in wisdom, for them that is difficult.

original: Appekadā, bho bhāradvāja, asubhato manasi karissāmīti subhatova āgacchati.
analyzed: appa ekadā bho bhāradvāja asubhataḥ manasi karissāmi iti subhataḥ uvaḥ āgacchati
translated: Sometimes, Master Bharadvaja, when I think ‘I will attend to foulness,’ only beauty appears to me.

original: Atthi nu kho, bho bhāradvāja, añño ca kho hetu añño ca paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā …pe… addhānañca āpādentī”ti?
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho bhāradvāja añño ca kho hetu añño ca paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā pe addhānañca āpādenti iti
translated: “But, Master Bharadvaja, is there any other reason, any other cause why these young bhikkhus, fresh and new novices, with little hair and beard, who eat in other people’s homes and are given almsfood, robes, bedding, and medicine,

original: “Vuttaṁ kho etaṁ, mahārāja, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena:
analyzed: vuttam kho eta mahā rāja tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena
translated: “Great king, this has been said by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened:

analyzed: tumhe bhikkhave indriyesu gutta dvārāḥ viharatha
translated: ‘Come, monks, dwell with the doors to your senses guarded.

original: Cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā mā nimittaggāhino ahuvattha, mānubyañjanaggāhino.
analyzed: cakkhunā rūpam disvā mā nimitta ggāhinaḥ ahuvattha mā anubyañjana ggāhinaḥ
translated: When you see a form with the eye, don’t grasp at its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam asavutam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: If you don’t restrain the faculty of the eye, covetousness and unhappiness will dominate your mind.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ, tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjatha. Rakkhatha cakkhundriyaṁ; cakkhundriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjatha.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyu tassa savarāya paṭipajjatha rakkhatha cakkhundriya cakkhundriye savaram āpajjatha
translated: So practice restraint, protect the faculty of the eye, and achieve its restraint.

analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā
translated: When you hear a sound with the ear …🔽When you smell an odor with the nose …

analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā
translated: When you taste a flavor with the tongue …

analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā
translated: When you feel a touch with the body …

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya mā nimittaggāhino ahuvattha, mānubyañjanaggāhino.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya mā nimitta ggāhinaḥ ahuvattha mā anubyañjana ggāhinaḥ
translated: When you know a thought with the mind, don’t grasp at its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ manindriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā🔽dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ, tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjatha. Rakkhatha manindriyaṁ; manindriye
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam man indriyam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ  dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyu tassa savarāya paṭipajjatha rakkhatha manindriya manindriye
translated: If you don’t restrain the faculty of the mind, covetousness and unhappiness will dominate your mind.

analyzed: savaram āpajjatha ati
translated: So practice restraint, protect the faculty of the mind, and achieve its restraint.’

original: Ayampi kho, mahārāja, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā bhadrena🔽yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ
analyzed: ayam pi kho mahā rāja hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesāḥ bhadrena  yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā a nikīḍitāvinaḥ kāmesu yāvajīvam
translated: This, sire, is the reason, this is the cause, why these young bhikkhus, tender, black-haired, endowed with the blessing of youth, in the first stage of life, who have not dallied with sensual pleasures, live the life of purity all their lives,🔽and at the breaking-up of the body after death are reborn in a good destiny, in a heavenly world.”

analyzed: parisuddham brahmacariyam caranti addhānam ca āpādenti iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause why these young bhikkhus, tender, black-haired young men endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though they have not dallied with sensual pleasures, live the complete and pure holy life all their lives and make an end of suffering.”

analyzed: acchariya bho bhāradvāja abbhuta bho bhāradvāja
translated: “It is wonderful, Master Bhāradvāja, it is marvellous!

original: Yāva subhāsitañcidaṁ, bho bhāradvāja, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena.🔽Esova kho, bho bhāradvāja, hetu, esa paccayo yenime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā
analyzed: bho bhāradvāja tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena  esaḥ uva kho bho bhāradvāja hetu esa paccayaḥ yena ime daharā bhikkhū susū kāḷakesā
translated: How well that has been expressed by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened!

original: bhadrena yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ🔽parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ caranti, addhānañca āpādentīti.
analyzed: bhadrena yobbanena samannāgatā paṭhamena vayasā a nikīḍitāvinaḥ kāmesu yāvajīvam  parisuddham brahmacariyam caranti addhānam ca āpādenti iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause why these young bhikkhus, tender, black-haired young men endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though they have not dallied with sensual pleasures, live the complete and pure holy life all their lives and make an end of suffering.

original: Ahampi kho, bho bhāradvāja, yasmiṁ samaye arakkhiteneva kāyena, arakkhitāya vācāya,
analyzed: aham pi kho bho bhāradvāja yasmin samaye arakkhitena iva kāyena arakkhitāya vācāya
translated: “Master Bhāradvāja, on the very day I was anointed, on that very day I became one who was not guarded in sense faculties, who was not moderate in eating, who was not devoted to wakefulness, who was not devoted to the higher mind, who was not devoted to the special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: arakkhitena cittena, anupaṭṭhitāya satiyā, asaṁvutehi indriyehi antepuraṁ pavisāmi,
analyzed: a rakkhitena cittena anupaṭṭhitāya satiyā a savutehi indriyehi antepuram pavisāmi
translated: with an unguarded mind, with mindfulness not established, with my faculties uncontrolled, I enter the inner palace,

original: ativiya maṁ tasmiṁ samaye lobhadhammā parisahanti.
analyzed: ativiya mam tasmin samaye lobha dhammā parisahanti
translated: then at that time the thoughts of sensual desire overwhelm me.

original: Yasmiñca khvāhaṁ, bho bhāradvāja, samaye rakkhiteneva kāyena, rakkhitāya vācāya,🔽rakkhitena cittena, upaṭṭhitāya satiyā, saṁvutehi indriyehi antepuraṁ pavisāmi, na
analyzed: yasmin ca khvā āha bho bhāradvāja samaye rakkhitena iva kāyena rakkhitāya vācāya  rakkhitena cittena upaṭṭhitāya satiyā savutehi indriyehi antepuram pavisāmi na
translated: But when, Bhāradvāja, on a certain occasion I enter the inner palace with a guarded mind, with mindfulness established,

original: maṁ tathā tasmiṁ samaye lobhadhammā parisahanti.
analyzed: mam tathā tasmin samaye lobha dhammāḥ parisahanti
translated: with my faculties controlled, then at that time the thoughts of sensual desire do not overwhelm me.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho bhāradvāja, abhikkantaṁ, bho bhāradvāja.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho bhāradvāja abhikkanta bho bhāradvāja
translated: Excellent, Bhāradvāja! Excellent, Bhāradvāja!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho bhāradvāja, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya,
analyzed: sa iyyathā api bho bhāradvāja nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned,

original: mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni
analyzed: mūḷhassa vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni
translated: or to reveal what was hidden, or to show the way to one who was lost, or to bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what was there—

original: dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhotā bhāradvājena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: dakkhanti iti evam evam bhotā bhāradvājena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has Master Bhāradvāja made the Dhamma clear in many ways.🔽Bhāradvāja, I go for refuge to Master Gotama, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha.

original: Esāhaṁ, bho bhāradvāja, taṁ bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā āha bho bhāradvāja tam bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to the Buddha for refuge, to the Dhamma, & to the Saṅgha of monks.🔽Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ bhāradvājo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam bhāradvājaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti  catuttha

analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time the Blessed One was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Atha kho soṇo gahapatiputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho soṇo gahapatiputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

translated: Then Soṇa Koḷivisa went to the Blessed One, and after paying homage to him, he sat down at one side and said to him:

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: And what is the cause, what is the reason, why some beings here, at the breaking up of the body after death, reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell?”

analyzed: yathā purima suttante evam
translated: (This sutta should be expanded as in the previous sutta.)

original: Ayaṁ kho, soṇa, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantīti.
analyzed: ayam kho soṇa hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, in the heavenly world.”

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, dhātunānattaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatā”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante dhātu nānattam vuttam bhagavatā ati
translated: In what way, venerable sir, has the diversity of elements been spoken of by the Blessed One?”

original: “Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, cakkhudhātu, rūpā ca manāpā, cakkhuviññāṇañca sukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati cakkhu dhātu rūpā ca manāpā cakkhu viññāṇam ca sukha vedaniya
translated: “Householder, the eye element exists and visible objects exist, and eye-consciousness exists.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Contact exists, and feeling exists, and perception exists, and volition exists, and consciousness exists.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, cakkhudhātu, rūpā ca amanāpā, cakkhuviññāṇañca dukkhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati cakkhu dhātu rūpā ca amanāpā cakkhu viññāṇam ca dukkha vedaniya
translated: The ear element exists … The nose element exists … The tongue element exists … The body element exists … The mind element exists and mental phenomena exist, and mind-consciousness exists.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of painful feeling.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, cakkhudhātu, rūpā ca manāpā upekkhāvedaniyā, cakkhuviññāṇañca adukkhamasukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati cakkhu dhātu rūpā ca manāpā upekkhā vedaniyā cakkhu viññāṇam ca adukkham asukha vedaniya
translated: “Householder, the eye element exists, forms are agreeable, and eye-consciousness is neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati adukkham asukhā vedanā pe
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, jivhādhātu, rasā ca manāpā, jivhāviññāṇañca sukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati jivhā dhātu rasā ca manāpā jivhā viññāṇam ca sukha vedaniya
translated: “Householder, the tongue element exists, flavors are agreeable, and tongue-consciousness is pleasant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of pleasant feeling.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, jivhādhātu, rasā ca amanāpā, jivhāviññāṇañca dukkhavedaniyaṁ.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of painful feeling.🔽“Householder, the tongue element exists, flavors are neutral, and tongue-consciousness is neither-painful-nor-pleasant.🔽Contact is the condition for the arising of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, jivhādhātu, rasā ca upekkhāvedaniyā, jivhāviññāṇañca adukkhamasukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati jivhā dhātu rasā ca upekkhā vedaniyā jivhā viññāṇam ca adukkham asukha vedaniya
translated: “Householder, the body element exists, tactile objects are agreeable, and body-consciousness is pleasant.🔽Contact is the condition for the arising of pleasant feeling.🔽“Householder, the body element exists, tactile objects are disagreeable, and body-consciousness is painful.🔽Contact is the condition for the arising of painful feeling.🔽“Householder, the body element exists, tactile objects are neutral, and body-consciousness is neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati adukkham asukhā vedanā pe
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.🔽“Householder, the mind element exists, thoughts are agreeable, and mind-consciousness is pleasant.🔽Contact is the condition for the arising of pleasant feeling.

original: saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, manodhātu, dhammā ca manāpā, manoviññāṇañca sukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati manaḥ dhātu dhammā ca manāpā manaḥ viññāṇam ca sukha vedaniya
translated: The mind element exists, and there are thoughts that are likable, and mind-consciousness is to be felt as pleasure.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of pleasant feeling.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, manodhātu, dhammā ca amanāpā, manoviññāṇañca dukkhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati manaḥ dhātu dhammā ca amanāpā manaḥ viññāṇam ca dukkha vedaniya
translated: The mind element exists, and there are thoughts that are dislike, and mind-consciousness is to be felt as pain.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of painful feeling.

original: Saṁvijjati kho, gahapati, manodhātu, dhammā ca upekkhāvedaniyā, manoviññāṇañca adukkhamasukhavedaniyaṁ.
analyzed: savijjati kho gahapati manaḥ dhātu dhammā ca upekkhā vedaniyā manaḥ viññāṇam ca adukkham asukha vedaniya
translated: The mind element exists, and there are thoughts that are to be felt as equanimity, and mind-consciousness is to be felt as neither-pleasure-nor-pain.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati adukkham asukhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the condition for the arising of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Ettāvatā kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho gahapati dhātu nānattam vuttam bhagavatā ati
translated: It’s in this way, householder, that the diversity of elements has been spoken of by the Buddha.”

analyzed: chaṭṭha  sayutta nikāya
translated: The sixth section on the diversity of elements is finished.

analyzed: gahapati vagga

analyzed: hāliddikānisutta
translated: With Hāliddikāni

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā mahākaccāno avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papāte pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papāte pabbate
translated: One time the Venerable Mahā Kaccāna was dwelling among the Avanti people at Kuraraghara on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

original: Atha kho hāliddikāni gahapati yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami …pe… ekamantaṁ nisinno kho hāliddikāni gahapati āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu hāliddikāni gahapati yena ayasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami pe ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu hāliddikāni gahapati āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avoca
translated: Then the householder Haliddakani went to Ven. Maha Kaccana and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, sat to one side. As he was sitting there, he said to Ven. Maha Kaccana,

analyzed: vuttam ida bhante bhagavatā
translated: “Master Kaccana, it has been said by the Blessed One in the discourse on the diversity of elements:

original: ‘dhātunānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṁ; phassanānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan’ti.
analyzed: dhātu nānattam paṭicca uppajjati phassa nānatta phassa nānattam paṭicca uppajjati vedanā nānattam ti
translated: ‘With the diversity of elements as a requisite condition, there arises the diversity of contact. With the diversity of contact as a requisite condition, there arises the diversity of feeling.’

original: Kathaṁ nu kho, bhante, dhātunānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṁ; phassanānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho bhante dhātu nānattam paṭicca uppajjati phassa nānatta phassa nānattam paṭicca uppajjati vedanā nānattam ti
translated: In what way, Master Kaccana, does the diversity of elements as a requisite condition give rise to the diversity of contact? And with the diversity of contact as a requisite condition, how does the diversity of feeling come to be?”

original: “Idha, gahapati, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā ‘manāpaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṁ sukhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: idha gahapati bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā manāpam itthā itan ti pajānāti cakkhu viññāṇam sukha vedaniyam ca
translated: “Householder, when one sees forms with the eye, if one discerns, ‘This is unpleasing,’ one discerns what is inconstant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the requisite condition for the arising of pain.

original: Cakkhunā kho paneva rūpaṁ disvā ‘amanāpaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṁ dukkhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: cakkhunā kho pana iva rūpam disvā amanāpam itthā etat ti pajānāti cakkhu viññāṇam dukkha vedaniyam ca
translated: “When one sees forms with the eye, if one discerns, ‘This is pleasing,’ one discerns what is constant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: Contact is the requisite condition for the arising of pleasure.

original: Cakkhunā kho paneva rūpaṁ disvā ‘upekkhāṭṭhāniyaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṁ adukkhamasukhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: cakkhunā kho pana iva rūpam disvā upekkhā aṭṭhāniyam itthā etat ti pajānāti cakkhu viññāṇam adukkham asukha vedaniyam ca
translated: Having seen a form with the eye, he understands: ‘There is a form object that is a ground for equanimity.’ And he understands eye-consciousness, eye-contact, and whatever feeling that arises with eye-contact as pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

original: Phassaṁ paṭicca uppajjati adukkhamasukhā vedanā.🔽Puna caparaṁ, gahapati, bhikkhu sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…🔽ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati adukkham asukhā vedanā  puna capara gahapati bhikkhu sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā pe
translated: Feeling has a cause and a condition.🔽Having heard a sound with the ear…🔽Having smelled an odor with the nose…

analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā pe
translated: Having tasted a taste with the tongue…

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā …pe…🔽manasā dhammaṁ viññāya ‘manāpaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṁ sukhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā pe  manasā dhammam viññāya manāpam itthā itan ti pajānāti manaḥ viññāṇam sukha vedaniyam ca
translated: Having felt a tactile object with the body…

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he understands: ‘There is a mental phenomenon object that is a ground for pleasure.’ And he understands mind-consciousness, mind-contact, and whatever feeling that arises with mind-contact as pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.🔽Feeling has a cause and a condition.

original: Manasā kho paneva dhammaṁ viññāya ‘amanāpaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṁ dukkhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: manasā kho pana iva dhammam viññāya amanāpam itthā etat ti pajānāti manaḥ viññāṇam dukkha vedaniyam ca
translated: Having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he understands: ‘There is a mental phenomenon object that is a ground for displeasure.’ And he understands mind-consciousness, mind-contact, and whatever feeling that arises with mind-contact as pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: Feeling has a cause and a condition.

original: Manasā kho paneva dhammaṁ viññāya ‘upekkhāṭṭhāniyaṁ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṁ adukkhamasukhavedaniyañca.
analyzed: manasā kho pana iva dhammam viññāya upekkhā aṭṭhāniyam itthā etat ti pajānāti manaḥ viññāṇam adukkham asukha vedaniyam ca
translated: Having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he understands: ‘There is a mental phenomenon object that is a ground for equanimity.’ And he understands mind-consciousness, mind-contact, and whatever feeling that arises with mind-contact as pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

analyzed: phassam paṭicca uppajjati adukkham asukhā vedanā
translated: Dependent on contact to be felt as neither-painful-nor-pleasant, there arises a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṁ; phassanānattaṁ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan”ti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapati dhātu nānattam paṭicca uppajjati phassa nānatta phassa nānattam paṭicca uppajjati vedanā nānattam ti
translated: So it is with reference to the diversity of elements that the diversity of contacts is to be known; with reference to the diversity of contacts that the diversity of feelings is to be known.”

analyzed: sattama  sayutta nikāya
translated: The seventh section on diversity is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Householders, the seventh, is finished.

analyzed: gahapati vagga
translated: The Connected Discourses with Householders

analyzed: nakula pitu sutta
translated: With Nakula’s Father

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāra gire bhesakaḷā vane migadāye
translated: One time the Blessed One was staying in the Bhagga country at Sumsumaragira in the Bhesakala Grove, the Deer Park.🔽Then the householder Nakula’s father went to the Blessed One,

original: Atha kho nakulapitā gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe… ekamantaṁ nisinno kho nakulapitā gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu nakula pitā gahapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami pe ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu nakula pitā gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and the Blessed One said to him:

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme no parinibbāyanti
translated: “Householder, what is the cause, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world?

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: And what is the cause, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a bad destination, a lower realm, a place of woe, hell?”

original: “Santi kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.🔽Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  tat ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati
translated: “There are, householder, forms cognizable by the eye that are agreeable, pleasing, charming, endearing, involving attachment, enticing.🔽If a bhikkhu delights in them, welcomes them, and remains holding to them, his consciousness relies on them and clings to them.

original: Tassa taṁ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam abhinandataḥ abhivadataḥ ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti tad upādāna
translated: When his consciousness relies and clings to them, he is dependent.

analyzed: sa aupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu no parinibbāyati pe
translated: A bhikkhu who is dependent does not attain Nibbana.

analyzed: santi kho gahapati jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ pe
translated: “There are, householder, sounds cognizable by the ear…

original: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.🔽Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati manaḥ viññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  tat ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati
translated: There are, householder, thoughts cognizable by the mind that are agreeable, pleasing, charming, endearing, involving attachment, enticing.🔽If a bhikkhu delights in them, welcomes them, and remains holding to them, his consciousness relies on them and clings to them.

original: Tassa taṁ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam abhinandataḥ abhivadataḥ ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti tad upādāna
translated: When his consciousness relies and clings to them, he is dependent.

analyzed: sa aupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu no parinibbāyati
translated: A bhikkhu who is dependent does not attain Nibbana.

original: Ayaṁ kho, gahapati, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti.
analyzed: ayam kho gahapati hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme no parinibbāyanti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, in the heavenly world.

original: Santi ca kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.🔽Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.🔽Tassa taṁ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti, na tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: santi ca kho gahapati cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  tat ce bhikkhu na abhinandati na abhivadati na ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati  tassa tam an abhinandataḥ an abhivadataḥ an ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ na tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti na tad upādāna
translated: “There are, householder, forms cognizable by the eye that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, tantalizing.🔽If a bhikkhu does not delight in them, welcome them, and remain holding to them,

analyzed: anupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu parinibbāyati pe
translated: then consciousness does not take a stand upon it and grow. When that consciousness does not take a stand upon that and grow, there is no descent of a new becoming. When there is no descent of a new becoming, renewed existence is not brought about. When renewed existence is not brought about, birth is not brought about. When birth is not brought about, aging-and-death is not brought about.🔽When there is the support of nutriment, there is the descent of consciousness. When there is the descent of consciousness, there is the growth of consciousness. When there is the growth of consciousness, there is the production of renewed becoming. When there is the production of renewed becoming, there is future birth. When there is future birth, aging-and-death is brought about.

analyzed: santi kho gahapati jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ pe
translated: “There are, householder, sounds cognizable by the ear…

original: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā.
analyzed: santi kho gahapati manaḥ viññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā
translated: There are, householder, thoughts cognizable by the mind that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, tantalizing.

original: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu na abhinandati na abhivadati na ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati
translated: If a bhikkhu does not delight in them, welcome them, and remain holding to them,

original: Tassa taṁ nābhinandato nābhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ hoti na tadupādānaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam na abhinandataḥ na abhivadataḥ an ajjhosāya tiṭṭhataḥ na tad nissitam viññāṇam hoti na tad upādāna
translated: When he does not delight in that feeling, does not welcome it, and does not remain holding to it, his consciousness does not become dependent on it and cling to it.

analyzed: anupādānaḥ gahapati bhikkhu parinibbāyati
translated: A bhikkhu who does not cling, householder, is totally unbound.

original: Ayaṁ kho, gahapati, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho gahapati hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattāḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyanti iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, in the heavenly world.”
